full_summary:
# High Seas Fisheries Enforcement Charter (HSFEC)

## Background
Canada requires a high seas fisheries enforcement charter vessel to conduct boarding and inspection operations on high seas fisheries in the North Pacific Ocean. Currently, the Department of Fisheries and Oceans (DFO) and the Canadian Coast Guard (CCG) do not have the necessary program vessels within the Pacific fleet to fulfill these requirements.

## Objective
This Request for Information (RFI) seeks industry input on candidate vessels and associated costs to assess the viability of chartering services for the HSFEC. This information will inform a potential subsequent Request for Proposal (RFP) phase, maximumizing best value to Canada.

## Key Components
* Assessment of candidate vessels and associated costs
* Evaluation of best practices for a successful outcome
* Solicitation of feedback and recommendations on issues impacting a supplier's ability to fulfill the requirement
* Gauging the feasibility of the proposed Indigenous Participation Component (IPC)
* Examination of how the proposed solutions will improve conditions for investment, enhance Canada’s innovation performance, and increase Canada’s share of global trade

## Subsequent Phases
A subsequent Request for Proposal (RFP) will be issued to select a service provider for the charter of a high seas fisheries enforcement vessel. Interested suppliers may submit a proposal containing the required information and services.

## Contact Information
For further information, please contact Melanie Girard, Supply Officer, Major Marine Construction Sector (MMCS), Public Services and Procurement Canada.

## Important
* The proposed duration of the services is nominally over a 3-year period, with the possibility of extending up to 5 years in total.
* Interested suppliers may submit their proposals in either official language of Canada.
* The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.
* Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada.

## Region
The requirement is for the Pacific region, specifically British Columbia, Canada.

## Solicitation Details
* Solicitation Number: FP859-220407/A
* Amendment Number: 2
* Solicitation Publication Date: 2023-04-14
* Tender Closing Date: 2023-05-24T14:00:00
* Amendment Date: 2023-05-17

## Joint Venture Liabilities
Canada does not accept joint venture liabilities for any damages or losses resulting from a joint venture or partnership arrangement. Suppliers must confirm their ability to participate in a joint venture in their proposal.
